realEstatePollutants.title: Major Air
realEstatePollutants.description: We spend more than 90% of our lives indoors and the air pollutants present indoors are 10x times more harmful than the ambient environment. Therefore, indoor air quality affects most occupants health. Various air pollutants in real estate such as residential areas and malls can exist.

pm25.title: PM2.5
pm25.description: Indoor PM or dust can be generated due to smoking, and combustion activities, and brought in by ventilation.

co2.title: CO2
co2.description: Ventilation and occupancy rates highly influence the CO2 levels in a room or enclosed area.

tvoc.title: TVOC
tvoc.description: Air fresheners, cleaning agents, paints, carpets, and furniture are some potential sources of TVOC.

co.title: CO
co.description: Various utilities such as fireplaces and coal burning emit gases such as carbon monoxide.

odor.title: Odor
odor.description: Odor is one of the factors that affect the comfort level of occupants. Restrooms are a major source of the odor.

smoke.title: Smoke
smoke.description: Cooking, fireplaces, burning of fuels, smoking, etc. release various air pollutants including smoke.

tempHumidity.title: Temp. & Humidity
tempHumidity.description: These two air factors play an important role in the comfort level of the occupants.

noise.title: Noise
noise.description: Hustle and bustle in hotels are quite normal. This sometimes creates a nuisance and disturbance for guests.

pm25.title: PM2.5
pm25.description: They have the ability to enter the bloodstream & can cause various diseases.

co2.title: CO2
co2.description: Excess CO2 can cause perspiration, fatigue, suffocation, convulsions.

noise.title: Noise
noise.description: Excessive noise can result in headaches & high blood pressure.

tempHumidity.title: Temp-Humidity
tempHumidity.description: Presence of more people increases more temp-humidity level.

odor.title: Odor
odor.description: When sweat and bacteria are exposed to gym fabric, produces a bad odor.

tvoc.title: TVOC
tvoc.description: Headaches, and irritation in the eyes, nose, and throat.

realEstateRisk.title: Who are at
realEstateRisk.description: People experience stuffiness in the air as the breathing rate goes up while exercising. That means people inhale more oxygen and release more O2 than the normal rate.

children.title: Children
children.description: Air pollution severely hampers and impacts cognitive abilities and growth, tissue building, organ functioning, etc. among children.

pregnant.title: Pregnant Ladies
pregnant.description: When they are exposed to poor air quality, both mothers and childs health are affected. Poor air can affect prenatal development.

old.title: Old People
old.description: Bad air quality promotes respiratory illnesses and disorders among old age people. Their old age makes them more vulnerable to illness.

healthIssues.title: People with underlying health issues
healthIssues.description: People with underlying disorders are highly susceptible to air pollution since their immune system is already weak.

returning.title: Returning Customers
returning.description: Good air quality encourages good business by creating a healthy and comfortable environment, especially for returning consumers.

staff.title: Staff Members
staff.description: When staff members are exposed to poor air quality, they experience reduced attentiveness and bad health that influences their attendance.

sensitive.title: Sensitive Group
sensitive.description: Children, old age people, pregnant ladies, and people with underlying health issues like cardiovascular disorders come under the sensitive group.

healthy.title: Healthy Individual
healthy.description: Even in healthy people, different air pollution parameters have varied effects on the body. Headaches & nausea are some of the symptoms.

realEstateSolutions.title: Air quality
realEstateSolutions.description: Prana Airs air quality monitoring and air purifying solutions give you the power to know what your residents and visitors breathe and what you could do to clean the air to make real estate properties pollution-free zones and view and analyze your IAQ.

realEstateComparison.title: The Effects of Air Pollution
realEstateComparison.description: When residents, customers, and staff are exposed to bad air quality, it affects their health, and therefore their overall experience. This majorly affects the real estate business.

realEstateFaq.description: About Air Quality Solution for Real Estates
realEstateFaq.helpText: Have questions? Were here to help.

questions.q1: 1. What are the health impacts of the pollutants present inside a mall?
questions.q2: 2. What are the major pollutants that are present in residential buildings?
questions.q3: 3. Why is it necessary to have air quality monitoring solutions?
questions.q4: 4. How can I check the AQI of a room and a specific lobby in a residential building using your device?
questions.q5: 5. Are any other parameters included in the monitors other than the air pollutants?
questions.q6: 6. Are there any additional benefits that come with the solutions?

answers.a1: Your health could be harmed by increased CO2 exposure. Health effects like nausea, vertigo, exhaustion, difficulty breathing, and perspiration can be evident in public spaces. Transmission of chronic illnesses like the flu and the common cold is fairly common.
answers.a2: Many pollutants can be present inside residential buildings. PM2.5, CO2, TVOC, CO, odor, smoke, temperature, humidity, and noise are the main pollutants that affect indoor air quality.
answers.a3: To know the nature of pollutants and how much they are present in a space so that necessary actions can be taken to improve air quality and protect occupants health.
answers.a4: Prana Air Monitors are WiFi enabled so you dont need to set up a wire framework to extract and display the data. Simply connect the monitor to the dashboard through WiFi connectivity and view the real-time data on your screens or mobile app.
answers.a5: Yes, our monitors include additional parameters like temperature, humidity, and noise levels which are important for overall comfort and well-being in indoor environments.
answers.a6: Yes, our solutions come with customized dashboards, mobile apps, and data analytics that help property managers make informed decisions about ventilation, HVAC systems, and other air quality improvement measures.
